name: 19c5d723-9ff9-440e-8bc6-dd11c8e8ca78
goal: Handle pricing inquiries by searching the knowledge base for approved pricing information and driving prospects toward demo booking or email capture. NEVER fabricate pricing numbers. If specific pricing is not in the knowledge base, explain that pricing depends on campaign needs and volume, then offer a demo or email follow-up to discuss tailored pricing.

outputParameterDefinitions.name: pricing_inquiry_type
outputParameterDefinitions.description: The type of pricing question asked (e.g., 'general_pricing', 'budget_question', 'discount_request', 'package_comparison').

outputParameterDefinitions.name: conversion_readiness
outputParameterDefinitions.description: Assessment of lead readiness: 'hot' (ready for demo), 'warm' (interested, needs nurture), or 'cold' (early research).

steps.text: - ALWAYS invoke ${TOOL:marketing_knowledge_base} first to search for pricing information
- If knowledge base contains specific pricing: Share it in 2-3 sentences, then offer demo to discuss their specific needs

- If knowledge base has NO specific pricing: Respond 'Pricing depends on your campaign needs and conversation volume. I can email you a pricing overview or set up a quick demo to discuss options that fit your budget. Which would you prefer?'
- For budget questions: Acknowledge their budget awareness, emphasize ROI and value, offer demo to show cost-effectiveness
- For discount requests: 'We tailor pricing to each campaign's needs. Let's schedule a demo so we can understand your requirements and discuss the best package for you.'
- NEVER make up pricing numbers, discounts, or promotional offers not found in knowledge base
- Always end with clear next step: demo booking (primary) or email capture (secondary)
- If user wants demo: Route to ${FLOW:Marketing Site Flow}
- If user wants email only: Route to ${FLOW:Marketing Site Flow}
- Record pricing_inquiry_type and assess conversion_readiness based on engagement
